content.div:
A few fun facts about Madonna's latest song off MDNA, which the Queen of Pop released Monday:

Fun Fact No. 1:

For an internationally famous 53-year-old musician, film director, business woman and mother of four, Madonna still considers herself a "Girl Gone Wild." That, incidentally, would be the name of her just-released electro-pop track, our second taste of Madge's forthcoming studio album, MDNA, out March 26. "When I hear them 808 drums/ It's got me singing Hey, ey, ey, ey/ Like a girl gone wild/ A good girl gone wild," she chirps on the chorus.

Fun Fact No. 2:

The tune has a Canadian connection -- one that extends beyond the average True Northern lady's love of getting dizzy on "Tanqueray" while yelling at the DJ to "play my favourite song." According to Billboard, "Girl Gone Wild" was written by Canadian songwriter Jenson Vaughan. He's worked on tracks for the likes of Timbaland, Blake McGrath and Kelly Rowland in the past, and hails from Vancouver.

Fun Fact No. 3:

Madonna's only ever played Vancouver once -- though she'll be back Sept. 29 and 30 on her upcoming world tour. (Further Canadian dates include Montreal Aug. 30, Quebec City Sept. 1 and Toronto Sept. 12 and 13.)

Fun Fact No. 4:

We've posted "Girl Gone Wild" below. Have at 'er.
